intro: Roldana suffulta, commonly known as the showy roldana, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Roldana suffulta thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
